description:
Member of Congress seeks an energetic and self-motivated individual to serve as a District Representative in an active Congressional district office. Duties include representing the Member of Congress in the community, maintaining positive relationships with constituents, other local elected officials, and business and community leaders and organizations.

Additionally, this individual is also responsible for handling constituent casework in their assigned issue areas, which includes answering casework correspondence, meeting with constituents, communicating with constituents, and serving as a liaison with federal and local agencies.
responsibilities: Representing the Member of Congress in the community
Maintaining positive relationships with constituents, other local elected officials, and business and community leaders and organizations
Handling constituent casework in their assigned issue areas
Answering casework correspondence
Meeting with constituents
Communicating with constituents
Serving as a liaison with federal and local agencies
qualifications: Must be able to work quickly in a high pressure environment
Meet very tight deadlines
Exceptional writing and organizational skills
Fluent in Spanish and Ventura County ties are a plus but not required
Must be available, as necessary, to work evenings and/or weekend hours
how_to_apply: Candidates should submit a cover letter, resume, and appropriate writing samples to CA26Resumes@gmail.com with just “District Representative” in the subject line. No phone calls, faxes, or walk-ins, please.
equal_opportunity: This office is an equal opportunity employer and encourages candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply.

office: Active, hard-working Democratic member of Illinois congressional delegation
description: Responsibilities include planning and implementing communications strategy across a broad portfolio, working closely with legislative and district staff to effectively communicate the Member's message, handling daily media inquiries, maintaining relationships with national, Chicago, and local reporters, writing talking points and press releases, pitching op-eds, overseeing paid constituent outreach (franking) budget, managing website, producing videos and social media content, and planning and promoting press events in DC and the district.
responsibilities: Planning and implementing communications strategy across a broad portfolio
Working closely with legislative and district staff to effectively communicate the Member's message
Handling daily media inquiries
Maintaining relationships with national, Chicago, and local reporters
Writing talking points and press releases
Pitching op-eds
Overseeing paid constituent outreach (franking) budget
Managing website
Producing videos and social media content
Planning and promoting press events in DC and the district
qualifications: Previous communications and/or Capitol Hill experience
Strong writing and oral communication skills
The ability to multitask and prioritize under pressure
Team players with a good sense of humor
Spanish fluency is a plus
how_to_apply: Please send cover letter, resume, and a writing sample as one attachment to ILCongressional.Jobs@mail.house.gov
equal_opportunity: Women, veterans and diverse candidates are encouraged to apply.

office: office of U.S. Congresswoman Katie Porter
description:
The ideal candidate is highly motivated and detail-oriented, with experience in digital media strategy, graphic design, and video editing.
The Digital Director/Press Secretary will be responsible for drafting statements, releases, social media copy, and advisories; staffing the Congresswoman, including taking pictures at community events and shooting direct-to-camera videos; designing graphics and editing videos; compiling daily press clips; and maintaining reporter lists. Candidates with Orange County ties are preferred.
This is not an entry-level position.
responsibilities: Drafting statements, releases, social media copy, and advisories
Staffing the Congresswoman, including taking pictures at community events and shooting direct-to-camera videos
Designing graphics and editing videos
Compiling daily press clips
Maintaining reporter lists
how_to_apply: Applicants should submit a resume, cover letter, a writing sample, and two examples of digital media projects to KatiePorter.Press@mail.house.gov and include “Digital Director/Press Secretary” in the subject line.
equal_opportunity: Congresswoman Katie Porter is committed to hiring and maintaining a diverse staff; candidates of all backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

description:
Active, hard-working Member of House Leadership seeks an outstanding Communications Director for a fast-paced office.

Responsibilities include planning and implementing communications strategy across a broad portfolio, working closely with legislative and district staff to effectively communicate the Member’s message, handling daily media inquiries, maintaining relationships with national and local reporters, writing talking points and press releases, pitching op-eds, managing website, producing videos and social media content, planning and pitching press events in DC and the district, overseeing daily clips, and keeping press lists up-to-date.
responsibilities: Planning and implementing communications strategy across a broad portfolio
Working closely with legislative and district staff to effectively communicate the Member’s message
Handling daily media inquiries
Maintaining relationships with national and local reporters
Writing talking points and press releases
Pitching op-eds
Managing website
Producing videos and social media content
Planning and pitching press events in DC and the district
Overseeing daily clips
Keeping press lists up-to-date
qualifications: Hill press experience
Strong writing and oral communication skills
The ability to multitask and prioritize under pressure
A good sense of humor
Connecticut ties are a plus
how_to_apply: Please send cover letter, resume, and a writing sample as one attachment to ctcommsjob@gmail.com

description:
Southern Republican seeks an experienced and enthusiastic Legislative Assistant to cover their work on Homeland Security Committee issues, among others.

The ideal candidate will have 3-5 years of experience, ideally 2-3 on the Hill, as well as a solid grasp of House procedures and a deep understanding of relevant policy. This is not an entry level position.

Excellent writing, verbal and organizational skills are essential along with the ability to be a self-starter while working in a fast-paced environment.
responsibilities: Drafting legislation
Writing hearing statements and legislative memos
Preparing briefing materials
qualifications: 3-5 years of experience, ideally 2-3 on the Hill
Solid grasp of House procedures
Deep understanding of relevant policy
Excellent writing, verbal and organizational skills
Ability to be a self-starter
how_to_apply: Qualified candidates should include in their application a resume and professional references. Please send applications to congressionaljobs2805@gmail.com with “Legislative Assistant” in the subject line.

description:
Qualified candidates should have a minimum of 2 years' experience
managing a team, possess excellent oral and written communications skills,
highly organized, meet deadlines, and manage multiple projects.
A flexible schedule and ability to travel throughout the district is required.
Equal opportunity employer.
qualifications: Minimum of 2 years' experience managing a team
Excellent oral and written communications skills
Highly organized
Ability to meet deadlines
Ability to manage multiple projects
A flexible schedule and ability to travel throughout the district
how_to_apply: Interested applicants should submit a cover letter, resume, and writing sample to cademhouseoffice@gmail.com please include Senior Staff in the subject line.
